title: Vols impress in fall softball
text:
Vols impress in fall softball season News Sentinel staff 5:00 PM, Oct 22, 2015 KNOXVILLE,TN - MAY 16, 2015 - Infielder/Outifleder Megan Geer #14 during the NCAA Knoxville Regional Tournament game between the Utah Utes and the Tennessee Lady Volunteers at Sherri Parker Lee Stadium in Knoxville, TN. Photo By Andrew Bruckse/Tennessee Athletics Andrew Bruckse/Tennessee Athleti Previous Next 
Tennessee's fall softball season is a wrap and got good reviews from co-head coaches Ralph and Karen Weekly. 
The Vols posted an 8-0 record with wins over Alabama-Huntsville, Tennessee Tech, Chipola, Lee University, Tennessee State, Shorter, Chattanooga State and Volunteer State by a combined score of 103-5. 
Tennessee batted .440 and got production throughout the lineup with a mix of seven returning starters from the 2015 Women's College World Series team and a touted freshman class. 
"We have a lot of confidence in our offense," Ralph Weekly said in a school release. 
Sophomore shortstop Meghan Gregg had a team-high 16 RBIs. Senior catcher Lexi Overstreet also had a strong fall, batting .438. 
Six newcomers batted .375 or better. Brooke Vines, from Rancho Palos Verdes, Calif., led the team with a .640 batting average, 16 hits, 13 runs and two home runs. 
"I saw a higher softball IQ in general from our freshman class," Karen Weekly said. "They play with a lot of energy and confidence and they're all ready to compete for starting positions." 
The stable of pitchers posted an ERA of 0.56. Freshmen Matty Moss and Bria Bush combined to go 6-0 and allowed only 11 hits in 23 innings. 
Seniors Erin Gabriel and Rainey Gaffin combined for 30 strikeouts in 25 2-3 innings. 
"We're going to have five pitchers that are going to pitch at different times, so there's a possibility we could pitch a lot by committee as we did last year," Ralph Weekly said. "We're going to have three seniors and two freshmen, so I feel pretty good about that." 
Added Karen Weekly, "We've improved quite a bit in our defensive play, which we needed to from last year."
